intro: Galium lappaceum, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems that root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and covered with fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. Galium lappaceum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
